item.title: Report X-2023100001
item.description:
Report X-2023100001

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: GEISMAR
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CANADIAN NATIONAL RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 15, 2023, CN transportation crews observed UTLX 130231 (Residue Last Contained / UN 1789 / Hydrochloric Acid / Class 8) venting from the top during a roll-by inspection inbound into Geismar yard. The railcar was isolated, all required notifications made. CN Contractor responded. Upon approaching the railcar, vapors were observed coming from the top. Upon closer inspection, puddled liquid was observed on the pressure plate. The fill hole cover bolts were checked and could be easily turned by a gloved hand. The puddled liquid was tested with ph paper and showed acidic. The fill hole cover bolts were tightened, and the leak was secured. The puddled liquid was neutralized, and the exterior of the railcar was decontaminated. The railcar was released back into transportation and allowed to continue onto destination.

item.title: Report E-2023100750
item.description:
Report E-2023100750

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 1-pint release of WD-40 from (2) 1-gallon metal cans and a 4-oz release of "WD-40" from (6) 11-oz metal cans. Only the cardboard packaging was impacted. The boxes were crushed in transit by other freight. 1) 5-gallon DM containing (2) 1-gallon Metal cans and (1) 5-gallon DM containing (6) 11-oz metal cans were overstuffed as waste and left on site for the terminal to manage. 03:10ET Louisiana Department of Public Safety was notified, report number 23-05002.

item.title: Report I-2023100038
item.description:
Report I-2023100038

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T00:34:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: New Iberia
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UTLX 648096 was involved in a derailment in New Iberia, LA due to a crossing accident. UTLX 648096 was derailed, sustained minimal damage and did not leak during the derailment. The Louisiana State Police issued an evacuation due to the hazmat in the derailment. UTLX 648096 was transloaded at a later date after the car was inspected and deemed no release occurred.

item.title: Report X-2023090161
item.description:
Report X-2023090161

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: Harahan
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 31, 2023, FRA hazmat Inspector observed liquid dripping down the sides of railcar UTLX 95658 (L / UN 3082, Environmentally hazardous Substance, Liquid, N.O.S) while inspecting a track at CN Mays Yard. CN Contractor responded and observed liquid leaking down the sides of the railcar and dripping onto the ground in several locations. Upon closer inspection, the manway bolts were found to be tool tight but still allowed product to leak. The manway was opened so the gasket could be checked. The gasket was determined to be heavily worn and deteriorated. The gasket was replaced. The manway was resecured. The exterior of the railcar was decontaminated. The railcar was released onto destination.

item.title: Report X-2023090160
item.description:
Report X-2023090160

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 23, 2023, CN Transportation crews reported a strong odor near RCRX 2119 while switching in CN Baton Rouge Yard. The railcar was isolated. All required notifications were made. CN Response contractor responded and upon arrival smelled an odor around the railcar. Upon closer investigation, the cause of the release was determined to be 3 of the 4 liquid line blind flange bolts were missing and all 4 of the vapor valve blind flange bolts were found to be less than tool tight. The missing bolts were found on the pressure plate of the tank car. The missing bolts were reinstalled, and the loose bolts were tightened which stopped the release. The exterior of the railcar was decontaminated, and the railcar was released and allowed to continue onto destination.
